Generation II.Gold: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
Generation II.Silver: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.
Generation II.Crystal: The fire that spouts from its back burns hottest when it is angry. The flaring flames intimidate foes.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pok é mon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
Generation III.Sapphire: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pok é mon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
Generation III.Emerald: It flares flames from its back to protect itself. The fire burns vigorously if the Pok é mon is angry. When it is tired, it sputters with incomplete combustion.
Generation III.FireRed: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It is timid and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.

Generation II.Gold: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town
Generation II.Silver: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town
Generation II.Crystal: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town

Generation III.Emerald: Received from Professor Birch at Littleroot Town after completing the Hoenn Pokédex
Generation III.XD: Reward for defeating 100 Trainers in Mt. Battle

Generation IV.HeartGold: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town
Generation IV.SoulSilver: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after first entering the Hall of Fame
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after first entering the Hall of Fame

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Grand Underground - Sandsear Cave , Typhlo Cavern , Volcanic Cave (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Grand Underground - Sandsear Cave , Typhlo Cavern , Volcanic Cave (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Jubilife Village : First partner Pokémon from Professor Laventon , Received from Professor Laventon (after completing Mission 18, if the player did not choose Cyndaquil) Crimson Mirelands : Space-time distortions (after completing Mission 18), massive mass outbreaks after completing Request 102)

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Polar Biome (after boosting biodiversity in the Polar Biome)
